entry.title: Don’t upgrade to Ubuntu 24.04
entry.summary: I recently upgraded from Ubuntu 22.04.4 to 24.04.1 after I got an official notification through the GUI, meaning no forced upgrade. It just killed my internet. A bunch of websites started showing “connection refused”. I tried everything incognito, DNS flush, multiple browsers, clearing browser history. Nothing helped. Also, there is absolutely no help on Google … Continue reading Don’t upgrade to Ubuntu 24.04

entry.title: The Quranic earth is flat. There is no misinterpretation.

link.title: The Quranic earth is flat. There is no misinterpretation.

entry.summary: The Quran, tafsirs and the siya sittah confirms that they believed in a flat earth. I know the Greeks said otherwise at the same time, but almost all the Muslim scholars believed in flat earth before the start of 10th century. This is mentioned in Hannam, James (2023). The Globe: How the Earth Became Round. published … Continue reading The Quranic earth is flat. There is no misinterpretation.

entry.title: The most insane proposal in regard to the Linux kernel development

link.title: The most insane proposal in regard to the Linux kernel development

entry.summary: In 2016, Artem S. Tashkinov made a proposal on lkml. The proposal: https://lkml.org/lkml/2016/4/2/76 Basically, proposed a sane idea to get newer hardwares working on old kernel. Al Viro replies in a disgraceful manner. The reply: https://www.uwsg.indiana.edu/hypermail/linux/kernel/1604.0/02006.html Greg Kroah-Hartman, a Linux kernel dev replies to control the situation. KH Greg reply: https://lkml.org/lkml/2016/4/6/646 To which Artem replies … Continue reading The most insane proposal in regard to the Linux kernel development

entry.title: Even Linux kernel devs know they have created a mess for companies looking to create drivers.

link.title: Even Linux kernel devs know they have created a mess for companies looking to create drivers.

entry.summary: I am quoting Greg Kroah-Hartman So, if you have a Linux kernel driver that is not in the main kernel tree, what are you, a developer, supposed to do? Releasing a binary driver for every different kernel version for every distribution is a nightmare, and trying to keep up with an ever changing kernel interface … Continue reading Even Linux kernel devs know they have created a mess for companies looking to create drivers.

entry.title: God of the gaps fallacy
entry.summary: I think logical fallacies should be mandatory subject in schools. A lot of theists make illogical arguments that ultimately rely god of the gaps fallacy. A notable example of this is how Sir Isaac Newton used the “God of the gaps” reasoning in his explanations. Newton devised a mathematical equation for the force of gravity … Continue reading God of the gaps fallacy

entry.title: GitHub Student Developer Pack: Namecheap crazy permissions

link.title: GitHub Student Developer Pack: Namecheap crazy permissions

entry.summary: As a part of GitHub Student Developer Pack, NameCheap provides a free domain for 1 year. I thought why not try it out. When I started to access the free domain, it literally asked full access to my Github account. It is like selling your kidneys to buy an iPhone.

entry.title: How to install Alacritty on X11 without building from source

link.title: How to install Alacritty on X11 without building from source

entry.summary: So I want to install a terminal emulator called Alacritty on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. Their github release page is mostly showing wayland based versions. I found two options. I am also avoiding building from source. Is the PPA trustable?
